Activity model Package¶

Data Preparation Module¶

class activity_model.data_preparation.Epc[source]¶

Bases: object

Class to represent the SPENSER data and related parameters/methods.

get_epc_dataframe(lad_code) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Get EPC data for a given local authority.

This function uses the EPC-API to get a large amount of data. Due to data limitation per request, several filters are considered.

Note 1: You need insert a valid EPC user/key (config/epc_api.yaml)

Note 2: Some data interval return Null value (usually in early 2008) and an exception is used to avoid errors in this case.

Parameters

lad_code (string) – Local authority code.

Returns

A data frame with all EPC collected data.

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

get_epc_url_filter()[source]¶

Build a list of EPC search filters urls.

According to EPC-API [documentation](https://epc.opendatacommunities.org/docs/api/domestic) the API is designed to return up to 10,000 records at a time, with a maximum page size of 5,000. If more than 10,000 records are required, is necessary to vary the search filters and make multiple requests.

This method returns a list of filter urls to get the maximum possible volume of data. Each filter url covers 4 months.

Returns

EPC-API urls with filters.

Return type

list

static set_categorical_code(df, df_col, lookup, rename=False)[source]¶

Apply the lookup to a categorical column.

Transform the values in a dataframe column using a lookup dictionary. This method is valid when the column values are categorical.

Parameters

  • df (pandas.dataframe) – The input dataframe.

  • df_col (string) – The column in df that represents the categorical values.

  • lookup (dict) – A dictionary from categorical values to categorical codes.

  • rename (bool, optional) – The new column name after transformation (if false, keep the current name), defaults to False.

Returns

Returns the data with the updated column.

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

set_lookups(df)[source]¶

Update all columns using the lookups dictionaries.

Update the information related with area, tenure, accommodation type, construction age band, main gas flag, and floor area, by using the self lookup variables (accommodation_lookup, age_categorical_lookup, age_numerical_lookup, floor_area_lookup, gas_lookup, tenure_lookup, area_lookup) and the set_categorical_code and set_numerical_code functions.

Parameters

df (pandas.Dataframe) – Dataframe with EPC information.

static set_numerical_code(df, df_col, lookup, rename=False)[source]¶

Apply the lookup to a numerical column

Transform the values in a dataframe column using a lookup dictionary. This method is valid when the column values are numerical, following the rule:

if (j < value <= k), then, (value = i).

Parameters

  • df (pandas.dataframe) – The input dataframe.

  • df_col (string) – The column in df that represents the numerical values.

  • lookup (dict) – A dictionary from numerical values to numerical codes; The dictionary structure is [[i1, j1, k1], [i2, j2, k2], …, [iN, jN, kN]], where: iN is the desired code for band N, jN is the minimum value of the band N (not included), kN is the maximum value of the band N (included), and N is the number of bands.

  • rename (bool, optional) – The new column name after transformation (if false, keep the current name), defaults to False.

step(lad_code)[source]¶

EPC data preparation main step.

For each given local authority, this functions get the raw EPC data using an API approach and then return a processed EPC dataset.

Parameters

lad_code (string) – Local authority code.

Returns

processed EPC data

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

set_new_tenure(df) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Create new temporary tenure column

This method creates a new tenure column (following EPC values) where the sub-categories - “Owned outright”(=2) - shared ownership” (=3) are merged into a general “Owner-occupied” (=1) category.

Parameters

df (pandas.Dataframe) – original SPENSER data frame

Returns

SPENSER data frame with a new column

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

step(lad_code)[source]¶

SPENSER data preparation main step.

For each given local authority, this functions get the raw EPC data from a zip file and then return a processed SPENSER dataset.

Parameters

lad_code (string) – Local authority code.

Returns

processed SPENSER data

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

Enriching population module¶

class activity_model.enriching_population.EnrichingPopulation[source]¶

Bases: object

Class to enrich a synthetic population.

To create a enriched synthetic population, this class combines two pandas.DataFrames using the Propensity Score Machting approach.

static get_enriched_pop(pairs, df1, df2, matches_columns)[source]¶

Returns the SPENSER enriched population.

Combine the EPC data with the SPENSER data to generated a enriched synthetic population. To combine the datasets, the propensity score matching method is used.

Parameters

  • pairs (list) – List of assigned pairs.

  • df1 (pandas.DataFrame) – SPENSER dataset.

  • df2 (pandas.DataFrame) – EPC dataset.

  • matches_columns (list) – List of columns name from EPC to be incorporated into SPENSER dataset.

Returns

The enriched synthetic population

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

static get_matches(distances, indices, n_neighbors)[source]¶

From the neighbors list get one match for each SPENSER row.

EPC rows with the same propensity score value have the same probability of being matched with a SPENSER row. The greater the difference between the propensity score values, the lower the probability of being drawn. The weight function used, is a step function.

Parameters

  • distances (list) – List of propensity score difference between the closest neighbors.

  • indices (list) – List of the closest neighbors indices.

  • n_neighbors (integer) – Number of neighbors.

Returns

List of assigned pairs.

Return type

list

static get_neighbors(df1, df2, n_neighbors)[source]¶

For each SPENSER row get a list of EPC rows with the closest propensity score values.

Parameters

  • df1 (pandas.DataFrame) – SPENSER dataset

  • df2 (pandas.DataFrame) – EPC dataset

  • n_neighbors (integer) – Number of neighbors.

Returns

The propensity score difference and the indices of the closest neighbors.

Return type

list, list

Return the propensity score values.

Parameters

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – complete dataframe

  • overlap_columns (list) – list of columns names that are present in both datasets (EPC and SPENSER).

Returns

list of propensity score for all rows.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

static save_enriched_pop(list_df_names, list_df)[source]¶

Save the synthetic population.

Save the synthetic population into a zip file. Each local authority is stored in a different csv file.

Parameters

  • list_df_names (list) – Names of each csv file.

  • list_df (list) – List of dataframes.

static save_psm_fig(df, lad_code)[source]¶

Save the propensity score distribution image.

This image is a way to visualize the compatibility between the two datasets.

Parameters

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – SPENSER + EPC merged dataset.

  • lad_code (string) – Local authority district code.

static save_validation_fig(df1, df2, lad_code)[source]¶

Save the internal validation image.

Floor Area distribution and Accommodation age codes distribution comparison between original EPC data and Enriched Synthetic population.

Parameters

  • df1 (pandas.DataFrame) – SPENSER dataset.

  • df2 (pandas.DataFrame) – EPC dataset.

  • lad_code (string) – Local authority district code.

Input dataset + new factorized Area column

static set_treatment(df0, df1)[source]¶

Create a “Treatment” column in each dataframe.

Parameters

  • df0 (pandas.DataFrame) – SPENSER data

  • df1 (pandas.DataFrame) – EPC data

Returns

Two dataframes, first the SPENSER data + new column (“Treatment” = 0), second the EPC data + new column (“Treatment” = 1)

Return type

pandas.DataFrame, pandas.DataFrame

step(df0, df1, lad_code, psm_fig=True, validation_fig=True)[source]¶

Enriching population main step.

In this step the EPC data and the SPENSER data are combined to generate an enriched synthetic population for a given local authority.

Parameters

  • df0 (pandas.DataFrame) – SPENSER dataset.

  • df1 (pandas.DataFrame) – EPC dataset.

  • lad_code (string) – Local authority district code.

  • psm_fig (bool, optional) – Boolean to save the propensity score distribution image, defaults to True.

  • validation_fig (bool, optional) – Boolean to save the internal validation image, defaults to True.

Returns

Enriched synthetic population

Return type

pandas.DataFrame
